page.title: 08THE OPEN DOOR EDINBURGH
page.content:
The Open Door was organised for people who liked to get together but who did not necessarily like going to church.
The premises, which at one time belonged to a grocer, opened in February 1982. It is open from Tuesday to Friday and is run bvy approximately 50{volunteers.}They hold a "Good Neighbour Club" every Tuesday from 10 till 3 which is attended mainly by people in their eighties. A Craft Club is held on Fridays.
This{Community Centre}survives on money made by sales of work and donations. It provides{snacks, coffees {and teas.}It also helps people with form filling or with everyday problems. On Sundays the centre is used by the Quakers.
